item.title: Home by Home, Russia Is Selling Occupied Ukraine to Russians
item.description: Kremlin-linked construction firms reap profits from redevelopment of housing destroyed by Russia’s invasion.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Coles

item.title: China Is Choking Supply of Critical Minerals to Western Defense Companies
item.description: Beijing is squeezing the flow of key elements needed to make defense systems, a sign of the leverage China has over the U.S. military supply chain.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: Opinion | Making a Palestinian State Less Likely
item.description: France, Canada and the U.K. encourage Hamas and Palestinian Authority intransigence.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Ukrainians’ Anticorruption Victory
item.description: Kyiv fixes a mistake, as protests show it remains politically accountable.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Trump Turns His Back on Venezuela
item.description: He pulled Chevron’s license to operate in the dictatorship, then quietly restored it.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: Opinion | Western Allies’ Self-Defeating Attack on Israel
item.description: By ‘recognizing’ a Palestinian state, France, Canada and the U.K. inflame tensions with Washington.
item.dc:creator: Daniel J. Samet

item.title: Opinion | Trump's Tariffs Spell Trouble for the Economy
item.description: The U.S. economy isn’t in a recession, but that doesn’t mean protectionist policies are benign.

item.title: Hamas Releases Video of Hostage Digging His Own Grave in a Tunnel
item.description: The video of emaciated 24-year-old Evyatar David is one of a series released by Palestinian militants in recent days that show Israeli hostages.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Trump’s Warm Embrace of India Turns Cold
item.description: Trade disputes and ties with Russia rankle the president, threatening to sink the U.S.-India relationship.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Why Isn’t Enough Food Getting Into Gaza?
item.description: A breakdown in law and order means aid is getting looted before it can reach the people who need it most.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Inside Kim Jong Un’s New Beach Resort, Where the Only Foreigners Are Russian
item.description: The first batch of outsiders were met with free jet-ski rides, an abundance of food and a $465 toy version of the Hwasong-17 missile.
item.dc:creator: Kate Vtorygina

item.title: Opinion | The Railroading of Colombia’s Álvaro Uribe
item.description: His trial has been marked by legal and judicial irregularities.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Former Colombian President Is Sentenced to House Arrest in Witness-Tampering Case
item.description: Álvaro Uribe, a U.S. ally revered for having battered Marxist rebels, received a 12-year term.
item.dc:creator: Juan Forero

item.title: Ukraine’s Supporters Plan New NATO Fund to Buy U.S. Weapons
item.description: The mechanism is part of President Trump’s plan to funnel more American equipment to Kyiv for its fight against Russia.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: Trump Positions Nuclear Submarines Following Threats From Former Russian Leader
item.description: The U.S. president criticized former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev, saying words ‘can often lead to unintended consequences.’
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Under the Rubble in Kyiv, a Rising Death Toll From a Russian Strike
item.description: Rescuers found more bodies Friday, taking total to 31 dead from Thursday’s bombardment of Ukraine’s capital.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: U.S. Envoy Steve Witkoff Visits Gaza as Trump, Under Pressure, Seeks Aid Plan
item.description: The visit, to inspect food-distribution sites and meet with locals, reflects a new sense urgency after cease-fire talks go nowhere.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Sarah Aspinall, Model and Socialite Who Lived Without a Safety Net, Dies at 80
item.description: A member of British aristocracy, she shared her husband’s passion for wild animals
item.dc:creator: Charley Locke

item.title: In a Country Trump Says Nobody’s Heard Of, Tariffs Bring Chaos
item.description: President Trump promised Africa that trade would replace aid, but in one of the world’s poorest countries his administration is slashing both.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Trump Should Get Nobel Peace Prize for Brokering Cease-Fire Deal, Cambodian Deputy PM Says
item.description: Sun Chanthol said Cambodia and Thailand would likely not have forged a deal to end the fighting without the U.S. president’s intervention.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: How a Youth-Led Backlash Pushed Zelensky to His Biggest U-Turn Yet
item.description: The Ukrainian president signed a bill that returned power to anticorruption agencies, the removal of which had lifted the lid on simmering discontent.

item.title: Salvadoran Legislators Clear Way for Bukele’s Unlimited Re-Election
item.description: El Salvador’s ruling New Ideas party eliminated presidential term limits, likely cementing President Nayib Bukele’s hold on power.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: Trump’s Vow to Be ‘President of Peace’ Falls Short in Ukraine and Gaza
item.description: President Trump says he has averted a half-dozen wars and deserves the Nobel Peace Prize, yet he has made scant headway with two of the most intractable conflicts.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: Trump’s Russia Sanctions Strategy Runs Hot and Cold
item.description: The president’s tighter deadline to reach peace with Ukraine and his threat against Russia’s energy customers contrast with a lighter approach to Russia elsewhere.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: EU Expects Spirits, Wine to Be Hit With 15% U.S. Tariff
item.description: The U.S. and EU are ironing out the finer details of their trade agreement. Wine and sprits are not expected to be exempted from U.S. tariffs, according to an EU official.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Inside Ukraine’s Effort to Fortify Hundreds of Miles of Defensive Lines
item.description: Kyiv must install hundreds of lines of defense fast enough to outpace Russia’s advance. But the effort faces increasingly long odds.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Global Trade Raised Living Standards for Millions. New Barriers Are Reversing the Trend.
item.description: In Indonesia and elsewhere, export manufacturing helped narrow the wealth gap with the West, creating a consumer class, but that transformation has stalled.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Canada-U.S. Trade Talks Might Fail to Produce Tariff Deal by Aug. 1, Carney Says
item.description: The uncertainty over trade is weighing on the Canadian economy.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Wider Recognition of a Palestinian State Leaves Israel More Isolated
item.description: Moves by France and the U.K. toward recognizing Palestine as an independent state could spur other U.S. allies to follow.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: U.S. Raises Brazil Tariffs and Sanctions Judge, Citing Trump Ally Bolsonaro
item.description: The Trump administration escalated its pressure campaign against Brazil, raising tariffs on the country to 50% and freezing U.S. assets belonging to a judge overseeing criminal proceedings against former leader Jair Bolsonaro.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: Tsunami Waves Reach U.S. After Powerful Russia Quake Forces Pacific Evacuations
item.description: The 8.8-magnitude earthquake triggered tsunami warnings in Hawaii and California, though the initial waves to reach U.S. territory weren’t significant.
item.dc:creator: Joseph De Avila

item.title: Why America Is Rallying to Save 400 Canadian Ostriches
item.description: Canada wants to euthanize birds exposed to the avian flu, prompting RFK Jr. and other U.S. officials to join the fight to save them.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: China Politburo Holds off on Further Stimulus
item.description: The country’s top policymaking body pledged to better execute policies that are already in place.

item.title: Stronger Than Fentanyl: A Drug You’ve Never Heard of Is Killing Hundreds Every Year
item.description: Ultrapotent synthetics, mostly from China, are easy to smuggle and mix into heroin, recreational drugs and gray-market pharmaceuticals.
item.dc:creator: Ming Li

item.title: Why Israel and Hamas Won’t Stop Fighting
item.description: Another breakdown of negotiations shows neither side is ready for the 21-month war to end. A deadly hunger crisis is taking hold.
item.dc:creator: Shayndi Raice

item.title: U.K. Gives Israel Ultimatum on Palestinian State Recognition
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said Israel must take “substantive steps” to improve the situation in Gaza before September.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: What’s Israel’s Next Move? Some Call for Full Takeover of Gaza
item.description: President Trump has signaled that Israel might have to take a new approach to its war with Hamas.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: A Buddhist Monk’s Alleged Indulgence in Money and Sex Transfixes China
item.description: An official probe into the jet-setting abbot of China’s Shaolin Temple has fueled cynicism about capitalism and religion.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Europe’s Star Economy Picks Up Pace as Fresh Tariff Hikes Loom
item.description: Spanish GDP grew 0.7% in the second quarter, a sign of resilience as the eurozone faces a slowdown from U.S. tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Kirby

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Cease-Fire
item.description: At least 38 people have been killed in fighting linked to a century-old dispute over the countries’ shared border.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: How Trump Got the Upper Hand Over the EU on Tariffs
item.description: European officials gave up on trying to avoid tariffs altogether and instead looked for the best agreement they could get.
item.dc:creator: Brian Schwartz

item.title: U.S. Promised Windfalls From Japan Deal. Tokyo Has Other Ideas.
item.description: Japan is playing down the risks from its deal after the White House said the U.S. would direct $550 billion in investments by Japan and keep 90% of the profit.
item.dc:creator: Yang Jie

item.title: CK Hutchison Seeks to Include Chinese Investor in Panama Port Deal
item.description: CK Hutchison Holdings is in talks with a BlackRock-led consortium to include a strategic investor from China to push ahead with its plans to sell ports on either end of the Panama Canal.
item.dc:creator: P.R. Venkat

item.title: China Strong-Armed Japan Over Rare Earths. It’s a Lesson for the U.S.
item.description: The U.S. found out this year that China could use its chokehold on rare-earth minerals as a coercive tool. For Japan, it was déjà vu: It had been the victim 15 years earlier.
item.dc:creator: Yoko Kubota

item.title: Trump Sought Escape on His Summer Golf Vacation. Some Scots Thought Otherwise.
item.description: A small group of protesters greeted the president at his golf course on Scotland’s west coast.
item.dc:creator: James Hookway

item.title: A Cosmic Mystery: Is China Building the World’s Biggest Telescope?
item.description: Top American astronomers are hunting for clues about a 48-foot-wide scope that Beijing isn’t talking about.
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Hopes Rise for U.S.-Europe Trade Deal as Trump Visits Scotland
item.description: Trump and Ursula von der Leyen, a top EU top official, are set to meet Sunday during president’s golf trip.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: Russian Plane Crashes, Killing Nearly 50 Aboard
item.description: The Soviet-era turboprop, a model with a poor safety record, crashed in a mountainous region in Russia’s far east.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Katz

item.title: U.K. Government Will Stick to Budget Rules, Treasury Chief Says
item.description: The U.K. government will continue to stick to its budget rules despite a series of challenges that include big changes in geopolitics and trade, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: U.S. Says Government Employee Blocked From Leaving China
item.description: The disclosure of the exit ban on an employee of the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office comes after Beijing confirmed imposing similar restrictions on a Wells Fargo banker.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: The U.K. Closed a Tax Loophole for the Global Rich. Now They’re Fleeing.
item.description: Instead of paying up, wealthy expats are getting out—sparking questions about whether the move will raise any money at all.
item.dc:creator: Natasha Dangoor

item.title: Nationalist Vigilantes Are Now Policing Russia’s Streets
item.description: Far-right groups are filling the vacuum left in Russian cities as many police officers serve in the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: A Day After Trump Promised New Arms for Ukraine, He Warns Kyiv Against Striking Moscow
item.description: The president’s call for Ukraine to avoid hitting Moscow continued his pattern of swinging between pressure on both sides to end the war and underscored the uncertainties about his strategy.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Defense Official’s Data Blunder Forced U.K. to Secretly Relocate Thousands of Afghans
item.description: The U.K. government went to great lengths to keep the mistake and its ramifications secret, including acquiring a rare court injunction banning all reporting on the matter back in 2023.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Putin’s Strategy of Paying Lip Service to Peace Falters as Trump Loses Patience
item.description: The president’s remarks during a cabinet meeting were the latest sign of his growing displeasure with the Russian leader.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Africa Wants Its Critical Minerals to Yield Jobs, Not Just Dollars
item.description: The Trump administration wants to cut deals to secure more of the key materials, but African countries are imposing export restrictions to help develop their own industries.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Congo Braces for HIV Surge After U.S. Funding Stops
item.description: U.S. funded treatments in the country have helped reduce deaths from HIV/AIDS to around 14,000 a year, from as high as 200,000.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: The Coup Leader Who’s Become an Anti-Western Hero in Africa and Beyond
item.description: Ibrahim Traoré, Burkina Faso’s leader, counts admirers from Nairobi to Jamaica and London. Russia is also courting him.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Congo and Rwanda Sign a Peace Accord in Washington
item.description: The deal opens critical mineral deposits to U.S. investment.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Air India Crash Investigators Recover Black Boxes as Death Toll Hits 265
item.description: An early focus of the probe includes a possible loss or reduction of thrust.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tangel

item.title: The Man in Seat 11A Who Walked Away From the Air India Crash
item.description: Britain’s Viswashkumar Ramesh said he doesn’t know why he survived, while more than 200 others, including his brother, died. In India, he has become known as the miracle of window seat 11A.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Air India Boeing Crash Kills Hundreds, Leaves Sole Survivor
item.description: The Boeing jet carrying 242 people crashed in a residential area shortly after takeoff. Only one person survived the crash, the first fatal incident for Boeing’s Dreamliner aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
